subtitle: Hello everyone, this is Gene, you may recall on my previous video where I said that not long
after my first astral projection experience, i had a much more profound one where i met a family in
the afterlife so i'm going to describe and explain that experience now, just before i do, i want
to give a shout out to all 15 new Patrons: John, Structured-somersault, Alice, Vanessa, Zoe, Karen, AJ
Shen, Alexandra, Asalia, I think that's how you say it, Brian, Joe, Muriel, Dier and Daniel
so thank you all for joining the group, we've already had some really interesting discussions,
dream interpretations and insights and everyone is clearly very interested in astral projection
and spirituality, they have a lot of wisdom to share and so it's clearly making for some
very beneficial and friendly conversations in the discord group so i really appreciate
that, and i also wanted to mention that Brian Haggerty in the group he says that he tried
the mantra that i revealed in my video where i talk about my simple method for astral projection
and he said that, you know, it worked for him, he started having vibrations but that he wasn't
quite there yet, but he recommends, you know, for everyone to give it a try, Brian is i think
the third or fourth person to say this now, so if you've not heard that video yet it's on the screen
go and try it out, if you'd like to join a group of like-minded people and have access to
the Astral Doorway Patreon and Discord then simply become a Patron - there's just one
simple, cheap option for the membership, the details are in the description below, so let's
get on to this experience, like i said it wasn't long after my first astral projection experience
i waited patiently for another experience after that, not worrying too much about when it will
happen, and this was the first time i actually realized in a direct way that the astral plane
was not just some place we go to during OBEs, but in fact it is the place of the afterlife
a lot of people ask, "what is the afterlife?" well it is basically the astral plane, but there is
more to it, it doesn't just have to be the astral plane, but i'll make a separate video on the
mechanics of death, afterlife, where we go to after death, you know, is it just the astral plane? can
we just connect back with, you know, source? with god? do we go to heaven and hell? what about
other planes? such as the mental plane? we'll get into all of that, but for now let me tell you this
experience, so i woke up in the middle of the night after just a normal night's, sleep out of habit
which i got into this habit of you know waking up in the middle of the night, i woke up in the middle
of my sleep, and i focused on falling back to sleep with full waking awareness, and as i went to sleep
i heard unusual sounds present themselves, you know, the normal crazy sounds that everyone hears
that you don't have to think too much into or get nervous or anxious about, you know it
involves things like loud banging, vibrating and it can even involve people speaking, now my eyes
my physical eyes opened involuntarily and the sounds would go, and i would close my eyes again
and they would return, so it's very important to be physically relaxed during this phase
and let these sort of sounds come in, you can see it as a sort of radio tuning into these
other dimensions, so whatever you hear on the way when you're lying in bed and you hear voices and
stuff, you don't need to make a narrative over them, you don't need to make a story in your head
you don't need to react to them, just let the sounds play out, it doesn't matter what they're
saying to you, you know if you're reacting and you think a voice is telling you
"the signs of god", then you're probably not going to advance beyond that phase, you need to just calmly
passively, impartially let all those sounds and visuals keep passing by you and keep growing
in your extra sensory perception, but at the same time it's a subtle art right? because if i
focus my attention on them too much, they would also disappear, so i let them be naturally and
naturally they seem to develop in intensity until they had consumed my full awareness
so in the same way, a convulsion, a deep feeling emanated from my stomach and it started to
engulf my body i began to vibrate, intensely, whilst also sort of feeling this sensation of falling
or flying, it's always an intense energy and so it's important to make sure that you let it be
surrender to it, don't try to control it too much, and don't resist the feeling amongst all this
you know hypnagogic colors swirl into your vision, that's what i could see and they seemed to be
struggling to form an image and as i focused onto these swirling colours i found myself merging into
a scene, those colors would start to magically form into this scene as if it was a art canvas
with lots of different colors and paints start to merge and go into this detailed scene and
i pushed myself into the art canvas so to speak, and i really felt myself
come out of my body and into this scene, into this art canvas, and as i did i felt kind of groggy you
know as if i'd just woken up, just remember the whole phase of separating into astral projection
is not a fully aware, fully sober experience, you know you pass through the stage of sleep
you pass through this sort of trance, you know you're very sleepy and sort of drunk and all
this extra sensory perceptions are happening and then you know, "pop", you come out into the other side
conscious but also you know you need to get your bearings a bit like you've just
woken up, so i found myself in this scene and i was already sitting in a meditative lotus position
in the middle of a stairway if you imagine movie scenes where the character is
trying to escape a building and they take the fire exit right? and they're they're walking down
this small cement staircase, well i was in just one of those levels of a staircase in a tall
building, and it was very gray and dull but sitting next to me in the same position was a man that i
didn't recognize, he felt familiar, it felt like i had already been sitting next to him for a while
as if i had just become conscious in the middle of the dream, which was strange because of course
just before this i was awake, so who knows part of my consciousness may have already been here
consciousness is multi-dimensional after all but yes i recognized him as someone
i knew but i couldn't quite put my finger on it, we were speaking to each other but i can't remember
the whole experience as i said, i felt kind of groggy, but i do remember the last part of the
conversation and he said "we will go up the stairs together" now he said this in a sort of cryptic way
and i knew he didn't mean as in like actually walk up the stairs, a woman was also in front of us
she was standing right in front of us, i didn't realize that she was there and she said abruptly
"we would expect you to go higher" now before having time to actually analyze her fully, two spheres
which were vertically connected by a bar or a cord in-between appeared above her head, i made a little
picture because it's a bit hard to explain so you can see it on the screen, i just made this
quickly in photoshop, and each sphere had a image inside and since she said you know we expect
you to go higher and the man was also basically telling me to metaphorically go up these stairs i
focused on the top image, and as i did, i began again just like going into the art canvas
i zoomed into the top sphere above her head and as i did the scene of the stairway began to fade
this was unintentional so i had a moment of apprehension i didn't want to wake up and ruin
what was happening so for an instance i held on to the man's arm to try to stay grounded but i soon
found myself back in my bed and i realized that i shouldn't have held onto his arm i shouldn't have
resisted what was happening, whenever there's an energetic shift like this we should just
surrender to what's happening i should have just gone into that sphere but anyway i was
back in my bed and i reflected a bit of course i realized that they were
metaphorically telling me to go higher in dimensions or higher in my consciousness so
you know i got back into a sort of zen state and quickly relaxed and fell asleep again
so soon after falling asleep i found myself in what seemed to be a dream, i wasn't fully conscious
and i was standing in an outdoor car park which was only about 100 feet from where i was sleeping
so this was you know just basically outside my house and you know just outside my house there was
these block of offices with a large car park space and i was standing in the middle of it and in this
sort of unconscious dream-like state i found myself gazing into the sky
and i had an immense feeling of awe as i stared at one of the most beautiful
multi-coloured masses of cloud i'd ever seen, i always enjoy the feeling
and sense of marvel when you look at something in a dream or the astral that you can't ever see
in waking physical life right? if you're ever in a lucid dream or astral i urge you to just look
at the sky you will usually see something very interesting and it can often lead to lucidity and
deeper dimensions of awareness and in this dream i saw these huge clouds and they were all
multi-coloured it was amazing to see, i can see it so vividly still in my mind, and amongst these
big beautiful multi-coloured clouds i could see what i could only describe as a UFO, it was black
but it was also shaped like the two spheres connected by a cord like i had just seen
in my previous experience, so it seems like my subconscious was still trying to
lead me to a full astral projection experience, you know a lot of people talk to me about their
frustration with trying to attempt astral projection experiences and they tell me
that "oh i'm really frustrated because i keep just having lucid dreams or i keep having dreams that
i'm astral projecting" you know these are actually all good signs; lucid dreaming is not something we
should be avoiding on the path, lucid dreams are important to connect with our own dream worlds
and we shouldn't be trying to get rid of them, we should be instead trying to integrate with
them and take advantage of them right? and this experience that i was having is a good example
of this in-between state between dreams and astral projection and you can see how that symbol was
sort of coming into my dream and as you'll see it shifts me into a full astral projection experience
so as i was looking at this sort of UFO but kind of subconscious projection of the symbol that
i saw in my last experience, i stared at it for about 10 seconds and then suddenly quickly it flew
to the left of the entire sky and it came in and out of these beautiful clouds that i saw and
behind it as it soared through the sky the back side of it let out the most breathtaking sight
it let out these floods of enormous multicolored clouds that filled the entire sky in seconds, it
was like a super volcano erupting sideways the clouds began to also pulsate dramatically with
giant orbs of colors coming out from them as if you were looking at lightning that's inside
clouds but they were also pulsating and all these colors happening so as you can imagine even though
i was unconscious in this dream the sort of shock and the sort of awe that was arising in me was
spurring on lucidity in me, it was giving shocks to my consciousness, and then i heard the cracking of
thunder and there was a sudden shift in the atmosphere, i felt an unnerving feeling from
the pit of my stomach, it made me take a step back but as i took a step back i hit the brick wall of
the block of offices of the building behind me, i didn't realize it was there and i just scurried
into a corner out of an insecure impulse and i saw the ufo descend and fly and crash
into the distance and exploded and i saw a sort of nuclear bomb go off in the distance
so out of all this fear, i got my phone out of course not a real phone, it's just an unconscious
dream projection, i got my phone out to call a relative in fear that i would die you know tell
them that i love them but as i did something in me woke up and thankfully realized that this was
a dream, so i did the 'hold-nose-reality-check' i realized it was a dream and i just got a full
control and a grip over myself and woke my consciousness up, and as i realized that this
was a dream i sort of also realized that this wasn't just entirely a dream and i was in a
sort of non-physical dimension of sorts, so as i compose myself i looked at my hands and attempted
to attain full waking consciousness and as i did my mind began to gain clarity and i witnessed
all my subconscious dream projections dissolve before my eyes, so i saw brick walls, trees, fences
and all those multi-coloured clouds all just begin to disappear they dissolved, vanished
as my mind gained clarity but the interesting thing was that i was still in the same location
near where i was sleeping and i was in the car park next to the same block of offices but now
my consciousness was completely different, you know a lot of people ask "how do you tell the difference
between a dream and an astral projection experience?" i do my best to try and describe
all the ins and outs and little mechanics such as you can't control the environment, but
when it really comes to it you can just tell the difference because it feels completely different
and as you're listening to this you're probably thinking "but you're in the same location, how can
you tell it's different?" well before you know my consciousness was asleep and now
my consciousness was fully awake and there is an innate instinctive feeling that through realizing
i was in a dream-like state, i was subconsciously projecting all sorts of unconscious things such
as the phone in my hand, the symbol in the sky that crashed and made a nuclear bomb
which was you know kind of ridiculous really if you think about it, and that when you fully
attain full waking awareness and you also practice meditation in your waking life you
understand how to stop dreaming and just be aware of your environment, and so here i was fully aware
fully awake in this astral plane, if you want to understand how this is possible, i made two videos
that i recommend they're called 'Lucid Dreaming vs Astral Projection' and also 'Shared Dreams
and Non-Shared Astral Projection', if you listen to those two videos, you'll start to understand where
i'm coming from, and part of those episodes explain how actually dreams can often be us unconsciously
roaming around in the astral and that's exactly what i was doing here right? i was actually in an
astral plane, i was actually connected to this non-physical counterpart of the physical plane
but i was unconscious, i was dreaming, now this doesn't happen all the time in our dreams
usually we conjure up an entire dream world right? so i mean we may be in the astral plane but we're
clouded by, well you know, we're in this our own orb, our own sphere of just a complete
dream world which we conjure up but obviously because i was practicing astral projection,
you know trying to wake up my consciousness, i wasn't just in a full dream world i was just
projecting a few objects and imaginations and hallucinations here and there
so back to the experience, i just wanted to clarify what was really happening there, and so back to the
experience where i had full waking consciousness in this astral plane which i could feel right
from the energy and the physicality of it where my perception was crisp, awake, untainted and i walked
towards the main road in the front of the building of offices, and i looked around my neighborhood
this main road was usually not that busy, and i just looked around it was a perfect replica of the
physical version of where i always come out of when i walk outside of my house, i could see the
shop that i always go to, i could see restaurants, the road was just completely the same, down to
lamp posts, different shops, the way the road was, even just the the markings on the roads
little patches of grass that are always there in the physical, trees - it was exactly the same, the
only two things that were different on this astral counterpart of earth, was the vast number of people
out on the street, there was a lot of people and what was also unfamiliar was this overly friendly
community atmosphere that i sensed from them, you know usually people just walk across this
street unconscious, nobody talks to each other everyone's just going about their business right?
but here it seemed that nobody had preoccupations everybody had a sense of joy or purpose you know
everyone was actively doing something, they were there for the purpose of being
there right? no one was really going somewhere so to speak they were enjoying themselves
it's something that you know i'd never see in the physical so i immediately sensed that even
though i was in a physical replica of my local location, this was different, you know when you
come out of the astral you can go to all sorts of dimensions, all right, but when your consciousness
is very objective and set to the same level or frequency of the physical earth-like plane, you
can go to these very similar locations, now i wasn't looking at physical people in this
physical location because also what was unfamiliar what was different was the sky, it had this purple
dusk in the sky, it was very magical, so that kind of said to me that this was a physical counterpart
but the whole atmosphere of this place was a bit more magical, there was something more special
and enlightened about this counterpart of this location, and you know just to add quantum physics
at the moment is talking all sorts of things about parallel worlds, if only they knew they
could access parallel worlds just like this that are at an arms reach within our consciousness
and you know this isn't just some hallucination or imagination of the mind when you experience
something like this firsthand the reality of it hits you profoundly and it's indescribable
how tangible and physical and real it all feels especially compared to our dense physical world
which in reality the physical world can often feel dream-like, and so i approached the pavement
with all these crowds of lively people walking by me, i could hear all their enthusiastic
and friendly conversation pouring into my ears, as i started to walk more i became surprised because
it became a challenge, i had to strain myself into a conscious and meditative walk it was like trying
to walk for the first time as if i had new legs, i was laughing at myself at what i must have looked
like to others, this is a common occurrence when we first started astral projecting and trying to
get a conscious grip over our astral bodies, but as i focused and strained a bit i got a hang of
it and felt a bit more stronger and as i got into this meditative walk, i started to feel even more
alive, blisteringly alive, and i walked along this pavement with all these people in just pure joy
and awe, i walk across this same road all the time in the physical but to experience it like this
in this enchanted and lively way was such a joy to experience, i had to make a conscious effort to
contain myself not to be too fascinated about what was happening and so i remembered my
intent for astral projection and out of body experiences, you know to understand the world that
exists beyond the physical and so i contemplated the lives of the people that i saw around me, i saw
many cheerful friends and family walking past me and i put my hand out at one of them
just to stop them and greet them, they were all very friendly i said "hello my name is Gene"
and i just smiled and waved and they were a middle eastern family of five they looked either arabian,
north african, or maybe indian, i couldn't quite put my finger on it but it was a family of
five; a mother, a father, a daughter, a son and a grandfather, who was in a wheelchair and he
instantly threw me into confusion because it was a non-physical world right? this was the astral plane
and he chose to travel around in a wheelchair, i wouldn't usually be surprised if i sensed
that this world was an unconscious dream-like world where people are unconscious, their level
of energy i just knew that people were conscious like me, and they were a beautiful family, they
had a lovely aura, a lovely energy about them, very happy and joyful, it was just a
joy to be in their presence and there was a lot of information communicated through that subtle
joyful energy that they were emanating, and a question just came out of me and i guess it
came from my intuitive sense that this just was the afterlife, i knew that these weren't people
unconsciously projecting out of their bodies and they also knew that this wasn't a physical
counterpart of the physical real-time plane of you know seeing and witnessing actual physical
people in waking life right? so there was only one other possibility and that this was the afterlife
and yes this question just came out with me i asked them "so do you know that you're all dead?"
and they were all just grinning and they said "yes" but they were all grinning
and it seemed that they could see through me right? they could read me and i said "okay, sorry
i was just curious, i'm alive and i..." you know i was going to explain that i'm an astral projector
in physical life but they interrupted me and one of them said "yes, we know", they were all just
knowingly looking at me and nodding with a sense of recognition, i wondered how they knew, i wondered
about the silver cord that i'd read so much about, i did look down at that point at my body
at my abdomen, i didn't see a silver cord, but i did feel a kind of emanating vibration in my abdomen
area, so i don't know, maybe that's how they could tell or it was just through normal astral
telepathy so i was just in amazement right? they weren't just conscious of their own death but
they also somehow knew that i was astral projecting and that my physical body was
asleep in the physical world, i also remember still thinking about the grandfather in the wheelchair
and there was a sort of telepathic interchange there and basically what the interchange was, was
that they recognized or, you know, they knew what i was thinking and the grandfather was kind of
you could say face palming himself, this is you know i'm trying to translate
what was happening in astral telepathic terms right? there's a communication
in the astral where you don't need to say words in english, so to speak, there's just a knowing between
people and yes he was like rolling his eyes at me, but also laughing at the same time that
I didn't get it, and the rest of the family members were laughing at my idiocy so to speak
and somewhere in me started to understand that you know he was in a wheelchair for a reason and
i'll explain at the end what i think this family were doing, so i clearly bored them and they wanted
to get back to their business so most of them continued walking, but the son stayed with me, i
think he was in his late teens and he stayed with me for a few minutes and told me about his family
but i can't recall most of the conversation since you know this was one of my first significant
astral projection experiences but i do remember the last part and i remember asking him we "were
all happy to know that you could still spend time together after you died?" he said "yes" to me
nodding his head, but he was half uninterested as he spotted his family in the distance walking away
from us, and so he left me to catch up with his family and at that point i started to notice that
i was losing feeling on the left side of my face for some reason i was just stood on this pavement
still with a lot of people walking past me and i felt the numbness of my face with my hand, i tried
to speak but to my amazement i could only utter gibberish, so as i said i was very new to all this
and it seemed that my abilities were coming to its limits, and as i struggled to stay in
that dimension, all of a sudden i was back in my bed, and i just laid in bed and reflected in awe
at what i had just experienced, all those people were in an afterlife that was extremely similar to
our physical earthly lives, in an environment that was exactly the same as the physical, so my
analysis and intuition of this, was that the family i met were purposely with each other to fulfill
their purpose and intentions of experiencing family life together, which they may have missed
out on in the physical world for whatever reason right? we're always so busy in physical life and
we have this innate feeling you know to spend time with our family, review our physical life
with them, but i also sense that maybe one or more of those family members died unexpectedly and this
sense of wanting to spend time with your family in the afterlife is also made even stronger for that
reason, you know one of the children were pushing the grandpa, so you know in physical life maybe
one of the children regretted the fact that they couldn't look after their grandfather at the
end stages of his life, so he chose to be in a wheelchair so that the children could
push him around and they could experience the whole purpose behind looking after their
elder family member, so yes in conclusion they were simply experiencing family time together
that they missed out on the physical world, so this is just a glimpse of the type of information
and wisdom we can find out in the astral plane, intimate communication with those
who are living out their personal journeys, their souls journey into the afterlife
you know things don't just stop when we die, you know i think for most of our souls situation i
think it's unrealistic to think that "oh life just finishes" right? a lot of people think that they're
taking a scientific or objective perspective in assuming that: "oh yeah there's nothing after the
physical life" there's even buddhists who say that you know "maybe there is no afterlife", well to
me, i would say that look if you want to be more objective about it and you really understand how
energy works, it's way more rational to assume there is an afterlife, because how can your energy
just stop right? we have our attachments and entanglements with the physical world,
for example think of a suicide bomber who kills himself and others in the process of his death
he's going to have some hard energetic lessons to learn, he's not just going to vanish into thin air
no, our actions have energetic consequences that we will have to face right? the illusion
that nothing happens and nothing matters is the biggest lie of our species, as we go about our life,
the deeds throughout our life, and the connections that we make with people, whether good or bad right?
whether it's positive or negative, or filled with strong emotions, especially, you know we have to
deal with those energies, there is a process before any sort of integration or moving on, we have to
realize and learn from and review our life, you know even physics says energy can't be destroyed
or recreated it just transforms, and you can't just think of that in terms of our essence or
soul right? because as i've been talking about on this channel, our consciousness is
multidimensional and parts of our energy are here and there in thinking about other people
in our dreams, our desires, and so the afterlife is still a continuation of all those things that our
consciousness projects and connects to, and so yeah don't assume that nothing is going to happen after
your death, in fact, assume quite the opposite that we will have to take a good look at our energetic
attachments and feelings about the world and our connection with others; things that we took for
granted in life, things that we did, things that we didn't do right? because i'm going into the realms
of karma now right? the Wheel of Samsara, i'll leave some links in the description for that if you want
to do some further reading, right you know and we pay karma for not just what we do, but also for
what we don't do, right? there's a lot of things in our life that we should have done, that we ignored
because we weren't fully conscious of what we were supposed to do, so i can get into all of that on
future videos, i know this went on a bit longer but i hope you appreciate my accounts and explanations
of my experience, so please be subscribed for more videos like this and similar topics, click
the bell button to know when i upload a new video, and i will see you on the next episode
